info.headline: Tornado Warning issued June 08 at 8:43PM EDT until June 08 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: The National Weather Service in Pittsburgh has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Central Monongalia County in northern West Virginia... Central Marion County in northern West Virginia... * Until 900 PM EDT. * At 843 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Mannington, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Monongah around 855 PM EDT. Fairmont, Pleasant Valley, Barrackville and Fairview around 900 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include Rivesville, Grant Town, Crown, Baxter, Rachel, Carolina, Metz, Farmington, McCurdyville and Georgetown. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
